p: This study provides the first characterization of the effects of the E. ciliata essential oil in a Langendorff-perfused heart model for the registration of cardiac electrical activity. E. ciliata increased QRS duration, shortened the QT interval of pseudo ECG, and reduced the action potential upstroke dV/dt ma, and the duration. A marked attenuation of the AP dV/dt max and slowing down of the spread of electrical signals suggested an impaired functioning of the Na +-channels, and the effect was use-dependent. Our results demonstrate that E. ciliata possesses features of class 1B antiarrhythmic preparations and, supposedly, might be effective in the treatment of the ventricular tachycardias.
